title: Jesus' Irreligious Beatitudes. #Blessed?
description:
The Good Place worked to teach Philosophy in a sitcom, but couldn't help expose our deep assumptions about what a good life is and what a good person might be. Dallas Willard in his book The Divine Conspiracy made the should-be obvious point that Jesus entered into this debate about what is a good Person in his Sermon on the Mount. Jesus began with Beatitudes, a declaration of about fortune easily found in the Psalms. Beatitudes in the Psalms are exactly what standard religious dictates. Do the right things and God will reward you. Jesus' beatitudes are radically different. Jesus life was radically different. He made that point without denying, however, the point he was contrasting. That was Jesus. 

the Philosophy of the Good Place https://youtu.be/stHk4_VePds
What Japanese think of religions https://youtu.be/7gZHuFtuzdg
The Divine Conspiracy https://amzn.to/2RRrWZj
Dominion by Tom Holland https://amzn.to/3b0otyV
The Shadow of the Sword https://www.amazon.com/Shadow-Sword-Birth-Global-Empire-ebook/dp/B005IEGKMA
Soul Searching https://amzn.to/2OjTxQF
